[{"idReadable":"P-458","updated":1669987611008,"resolved":null,"summary":"Tech debts","reporter":{"login":"ykoval","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

Tech debts done:

  1. renamed ptoCorrection usages to ptoCompensation
  2. localized Refunds Page and CreateRefund Dialog
  3. changed appearance of DataGrids:
    • all:
      1. changed capitalization of all headerNames and labels in FormDialogs (was - 'Full Name', now - 'Full name')
      2. made headerNamed aligned to center
      3. updated columns' sizes
    • Refund - made Delete refund icon as first column in DataGrid; applied financial column style to 'Amount' column
    • Pto - renamed 'Correction' column to 'Compensation' and moved to last place in columns sequence
    • Staff - removed 'startDateTime' column

{"idReadable":"P-453","updated":1669975493781,"resolved":null,"summary":"Payments are not loaded according to selected date in DatePicker","reporter":{"login":"ykoval","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Go to https://finance-stg.intelliarts.com/payments?date=2022-10-25T13%3A23%3A02.847Z (or any other Date != Date.now (default date))
  2. Refresh page

Expected behaviour:

  1. Payments are rendered with the date that correspond one picked in DatePicker

Actual:

  1. Payments are rendered with values that correspond to payments for default date

dev notes:

  1. Seems like payments are not replaced in store on Page refresh properly

{"idReadable":"P-426","updated":1669972988057,"resolved":null,"summary":"Add rule about 22 days for PTO","reporter":{"login":"ocheban","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[{"deleted":false,"textPreview":"

Ask KT or AZ is 2 extra days apply only for full-year employee

","author":{"login":"Taras_Kondratiuk","name":"Taras Kondratiuk","$type":"User"},"updated":null,"created":1669640359105,"id":"4-275","$type":"IssueComment"}],"wikifiedDescription":"

DOD:

  • The number of available dayoffs should be increased to 22 days
  • the calculation process should be covered with tests
  • Pto Compensation if you got less then 20 (positive) day offs or more then 22 (negative).
  • If day offs are more then 22 then (negative compensation) = (actual day offs) - 22
  • Does not affect sick leaves.

dev notes:

  • fix TODO in the Payment test

DOD:

  • There is a "Send to Xero" button on Paymets Sidebar
  • The Button is enabled only if the Page shows closed Payments
  • Click on the Button sends Payment IDs to be sent to Xero
  • Payroll makes a request to a fake URL with a payload that contains aggregated Payments that correspond to received IDs
  • Restrict access to Admin only

{"idReadable":"X-24","updated":1669306029062,"resolved":null,"summary":"Show new column after Final Amount with Transferred amount from BankStatement file","reporter":{"login":"Taras_Kondratiuk","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

DOD:

  • in case of validation error, a new column "Transferred amount" appears
  • column "Transferred amount" is located after "Final Amount"
  • column "Transferred amount" holds amount from BankStatement OR text "Absent" in case of its absence

dev notes:

  • create separate store for validation errors

{"idReadable":"P-300","updated":1669297434069,"resolved":null,"summary":"Support user specific PaydDayOffs","reporter":{"login":"vdmytruk","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

Currently, the PTO service assumes that all users have 20 PaydDayOffs (PDO). In practice, there are a few exceptions. E.g. parents have additional 5 PaydDayOffs, Those who spent 20 days for vacations have additional 2 PaydDayOffs. Hubspot team has some PDO paid by the customer.

This story is about dealing with such cases.
Acceptance criteria

  • It is possible to configure the number of PDO per employee
  • Employee related number of PDO is used for PTO calculations
  • Default value for PDO is 20

","author":{"login":"vdmytruk","name":"Vitalii Dmytruk","$type":"User"},"updated":null,"created":1664203064153,"id":"4-257","$type":"IssueComment"}],"wikifiedDescription":"

Probably this ticket will be split into more.

  1. Investigate how to add UUID to request(s) which is passing through all microservices, probably needs investigation of all possible workflows and interactions between microservices
  2. add lib, service, which can easily be plugged into NodeJs and Spring, which adds UUID to requests
  3. Investigate how to store and aggregate logs, with the possibility to search by UUID
  4. implement/use service - for storing and aggregating logs
  5. add library/service to each BE to send logs to a centralized place

DOD:

  1. Document with existing solutions for adding UUID's to http requests;
  2. Integrate http request with a new library - for adding UUID's to requests
  3. Document with a description of services and or frameworks and or libraries which can store, aggregate, and give a possibility to search in logs
  4. Merge request, or new deployment, or credentials to a service, which will be storing logs
  5. Merge request for NodeJS and Spring adding external logger lib to report each action to a centralized log store.
    (optional)
  6. Investigate how to import existing logs to new centralized system

  • verify all services started (Listening on port NNNN)
  • shutdown Eureka
  • .
  • PROFIT

{"idReadable":"X-6","updated":1666009439651,"resolved":null,"summary":"Validate that parsed payments from CSV file is equal open payments","reporter":{"login":"Taras_Kondratiuk","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

DOD:

  • Only if parsed payments from CSV file is equal to open payments, open payments should be closed
  • There is loading animation on CSV file uploading
  • There is successful/error snackbar on Payrol WEB that informs admin about result of closing open payments
  • Failed to close payments should be listed in response (conduct Contract)

Q&A:

  • to close payments should we rely on response from Xero (when they were uploaded and accepted) or should we rely on result of parsed CSV's?
  • we can map transaction to users payment using IBAN / EDRPOU / any other field from BankDetails. which one we choose?

DOD

  • It is possible to use Xero API from the Xero service without UI (BE authentication & authorization)
  • Results of Xero API calls can be logged

dev notes

  • use Nest framework
  • check this guide https://developer.xero.com/documentation/guides/oauth2/auth-flow

DOD:

  • Admin can update "Cash" column on Payments Page for open Payment
  • A value which admin updates in Payments Page should apply only for current open Payment for the current month
  • If the admin doesn't update "Cash" column on the Payments Page, the value(default value for Staffer which will apply every next month) should take from the Staffer

{"idReadable":"P-314","updated":1664895442951,"resolved":null,"summary":"Use common CoworkingCost value","reporter":{"login":"Taras_Kondratiuk","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

Currently, Coworking Cost is set per person on the Staf Page. At the same time, AdminSettings also have a common CoworkingCost value which is not used. This story is about migration from "per person" to "common" value for CoworkingCost

To Discuss:
ask KT whether it is required to set a custom value for a particular contractor for a particular month (value applied for a single payment)

DOD

  1. CoworkingCost column header changed to "Pays for Coworking"
  2. Staf Page shows checkboxes instead of CoworkingCost value
  3. Payment includes CoworkingCost for those Staffers who have "Pays for Coworking" flag ticked
  4. Payment is calculated using CoworkingCost set on the AdminSettings Page

{"idReadable":"P-308","updated":1664895442950,"resolved":null,"summary":"Calculate finalPayment for Employees","reporter":{"login":"ykoval","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

formula:

ROUND ( Final (Column M) - Card Wire (column O) )

dev:

There is a calculating strategy that includes all calculators to calculate the payment for every Employee:

  • SalaryCalculator
  • PtoCompensantionCalculator
  • RefundsCalculator
  • LoanCalculator
  • CompensationCalculator
  • CorrectionCalculator
  • CashCalculator
  • BankFeeCalculator

DOD:

  • Final Payment for Employees is calculated on BE and shown in the Payment's Page

As a foodlord I can update the published menu without "unpublish" it.
Acceptance criteria

  • On the first change of the published menu "Publish" button changes status to enabled
  • The text of the button is Re-publish if published menu is changed

Foodlord archives used Dishes instead of deleting them
Acceptance criteria

  • If a Dish is used in purchased menu its "Delete" button is replaced by "Archive"
  • "Not used" Dishes can be deleted
  • Archived dishes can not be added to the Menu

update","reporter":{"login":"vdmytruk","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

Acceptance criteria

  • Dish is copied on update
  • In case the updated Dish is used in a purchased Menu the old version of the Dish should be preserved in the Menu
  • In case the updated dish is used in a Menu other than purchased, the new updated version of the Dish is used

  • Dependency with Payment Status are removed
  • Payments' persistence on GET endpoint is removed
  • Payments' closing flow is updated
  • Open payments are deleted in DBs on qa,stage,prod envs

dev notes:

  • send List<Payment> as closePayments method's payload

Users","reporter":{"login":"vdmytruk","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[],"wikifiedDescription":"

DOD

  • PTOs are generated based on active users for now
  • PTOs are generated with no relation to users list in spreadsheet
  • New User in the system generates new PTO
  • Archiving of the User on the users service removes its PTO from the PTO list

dev notes:

  • calculate PTO for a single (active) user instead of calculating for "all active users at a time"

  • Archiving of the User on the users service makes it not possible to generate Payment for them

dev notes:

  • Remove writing PTO result into SS

DOD

  • Payments Amount contains PTO compensation
  • PTOs are calculated for the period from 01/01/{currentYear} to the end of the month in a given date
  • PTO compensation are added to the Payment Amount only if the month is December
